name: Introduction to Anthropology
description: A course introducing the fundamentals of anthropology, including physical anthropology, archaeology, and cultural anthropology.

name: Cultural Anthropology
description: A course focusing on the study of human culture, including the study of social organizations, language, religion, and other aspects of human societies.

name: Archaeology
description: A course focusing on the study of human history and prehistory through the analysis of material culture.

name: Physical Anthropology
description: A course focusing on the study of the biological and behavioral aspects of humans, their extinct hominin ancestors, and their primate relatives.

name: Advanced Cultural Anthropology
description: A course focusing on more advanced topics in cultural anthropology, such as social change, power and politics, and globalization.

name: Advanced Archaeology
description: A course focusing on more advanced topics in archaeology, such as archaeological theory, archaeological methods, and archaeological analysis.

name: Advanced Physical Anthropology
description: A course focusing on more advanced topics in physical anthropology, such as human evolution, primate behavior, and human genetics.
